subject: CBS News Sunday Morning: Close look at cover girls
body:
CBSNews.com












  Home | U.S. | World | Politics | SciTech | Health | Entertainment | Business | Opinion | Sports | Blogs | Interactives | Video 

  The Early Show | CBS Evening News | 48 Hours | 60 Minutes | The Saturday Early Show | CBS Sunday Morning | Face The Nation 






May 11, 
      2007
Hello, 
      everyone,
Happy Mother’s 
      Day!
This Sunday Morning:
They are household 
      names: Christie, Paulina, Heidi and Tyra, supermodels 
      all. Correspondent Russ Mitchell takes a look at the changing faces of 
      fashion’s cover girls.
From Los Angeles, Sandra Hughes has the story of a 26-year-old who stirs hearts with his special 
      blend of pop and classical music, singer Josh Groban.
What’s loud, fast and has much of its action in grease 
      pits? NASCAR -- and it’s hot! Tracy 
      Smith reports through the smoke, grime and smell of burning rubber on the 
      growing love affair between women and NASCAR. 
Ever wonder why animals behave so well on stage and screen, but you can’t get Fido to sit for 
      more than two seconds? Correspondent Martha Teichner shows you some tricks 
      of the trade with William Berloni, the man who trains dogs for the movies 
      and Broadway stage.
Serena Altschul shares a few lessons about makeup, and
Bill Geist hits the road to find out what it’s 
      like being a traveling 
      salesman.
All that and more, this 
      Sunday Morning.
Listen for our 
      trumpet!
